Package aeneas.models

The models package contains the classes which define and store the state of the game.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Level.LevelWithMoves
    A level that has a maximum number of moves
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Board
    Represents a board for a KabaSuji level A board keeps track of its pieces, hints, and the shape of the board.
    Bullpen
    A bullpen is a list of pieces available to the player.
    Bullpen.BullpenLogic
    Represents the logic of a bullpen.
    DragType
    Used to specify the type of a dragged object for drag and drop
    Level
    Abstract base class representing a level of KabaSuji.
    Level.Metadata
    stored metadata for the level, used to load the levels
    LevelGenerator
    generates the initial levels
    LevelIndex
    Class responsible for loading levels.
    LightningBoard
    A Subclass of board with functionality specific to lightning mode.
    LightningLevel
    A subclass of level with functionality specific to lightning mode.
    Model
    Top level entity class for KabaSuji.
    Piece
    A hexonimo or piece used to play KabaSuji.
    PieceFactory
    A factory to get the hexonimoes based on their number from 0-35.
    PlacedPiece
    Contains a piece and a location.
    PuzzleBoard
    Concrete board class for puzzle mode
    PuzzleLevel
    Concrete level class for puzzle mode
    ReleaseBoard
    Concrete board class for release mode
    ReleaseLevel
    Concrete level class for release mode
    ReleaseNumber
    A number on a release board
    Square
    Represents a square of a piece or board.

    Enum Description
    DragType.Type
    Type of dragged object
    Piece.Axis
    An axis to flip a piece around.
    Piece.Dir
    A direction to rotate.

Package aeneas.models Description

The models package contains the classes which define and store the state of the game. It includes things like the definition of a level, of pieces, and of the boards. It also contains the high-level model object, which is often used as a common object passed around to call functions outside of the scrope of any individual level.
